main event: A witness observed one round object in the sky on April 6, 1956, which appeared to be fifty times bigger and brighter than a star.
interesting points: The object was light blue and traveled very fast., It was visible for one minute., The object was also observed by GOC in Spartanburg, S.C., The sighting occurred under clear skies with unlimited visibility., There is a possibility that the observed object was actually the planet Jupiter or the star Sirius.
sighted object: one round light blue object in the sky
witness description: The witness was a civilian observer who viewed the object through an automobile windshield.
